edu.ksu.cs.cc410.register

Class CashDrawer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ksu.cs.cc410.register.CashDrawer

  • public class CashDrawer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent a cash drawer.

    Typical use is to instantiate a drawer and call getCount() and getTotal() methods to get the state of the drawer while closed.

    To perform a transaction, call open() to open the drawer, providing the amount to be deposited. Then, use addCount() and removeCount() to update the amounts of each denomination in the drawer as the customer provides cash and change is made and given back to the customer. Finally, call close() to close the drawer. The class will verify that the amount in the drawer reflects the original amount plus the transaction amount

    See Also:
    CashDenomination

      • addCount

        public void addCount(CashDenomination denom,
                     int count)
        Add to the count of the denomination in the drawer.
        Parameters:
        denom - the denomination to add to
        count - the count to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the drawer is not open
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the count is negative

      • removeCount

        public void removeCount(CashDenomination denom,
                        int count)
        Remove from the count of the denomination in the drawer.
        Parameters:
        denom - the denomination to remove from
        count - the count to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the drawer is not open
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the count is negative
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the count is more than the number present

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the cash drawer.

        If the contents are incorrect, the drawer is not closed.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the cash drawer contents are incorrect
